description: Foreign swarm genesis: hono web framework — first real persistent application of genesis_foreign.sh
hypothesis: Swarm protocol transfers to external codebases and produces meaningful knowledge accumulation that persists across sessions

target_repository.name: hono
target_repository.description: Ultrafast web framework built on Web Standards, multi-runtime (CF Workers, Deno, Bun, Node, AWS Lambda)
target_repository.complexity: Medium-high (5 routers, 9 adapters, 2400-line type system, JSX engine)

architecture_mapped.multi_strategy_routing: SmartRouter tries RegExpRouter (O(1) mega-regex) then TrieRouter (O(segments)). Lazy lock-in on first match.
architecture_mapped.fetch_api_abstraction: 9 adapters all convert to/from Fetch API Request/Response. Adapters and presets orthogonal.
architecture_mapped.implicit_finalization: No res.send(). c.res setter finalizes context. Header merging on re-set.
architecture_mapped.type_level_path_parsing: 2474-line types.ts parses path strings at compile time. 30+ overloads per method. 7-handler limit.
architecture_mapped.fluent_state_accumulator: HTTP methods dynamically generated. Mutable #path enables .get('/path').post(handler) chaining.
architecture_mapped.compose_engine: 74-line Koa-style middleware chain. Single-handler fast path skips compose entirely.
architecture_mapped.head_method_rewrite: HEAD dispatched as GET with body stripped at dispatch level.
architecture_mapped.mount_agnosticism: .mount() accepts any (request)->Response function, not just Hono apps.

key_insights.L-001: 5-router architecture is multi-strategy dispatch, not redundancy
key_insights.L-002: Multi-runtime rests on one abstraction: the Fetch API
key_insights.L-003: Implicit finalization via c.res setter with header merging side effects
key_insights.L-004: 2400+ lines of type gymnastics parse path strings at compile time
key_insights.L-005: State accumulator pattern for fluent API — mutable #path is the trick

validation_criteria.knowledge_accumulation: CONFIRMED: 5 lessons with specific code citations, not generic summaries
validation_criteria.external_focus: CONFIRMED: All knowledge is about hono, not about swarm
validation_criteria.actionable_insights: CONFIRMED: F1 (router benchmarking) and F4 (header merging test) are directly actionable
validation_criteria.future_session_handoff: CONFIRMED: NEXT.md, INDEX.md, FRONTIER.md all populated for session 2
validation_criteria.persistent_storage: CONFIRMED: Committed to local repo at /mnt/c/Users/canac/REPOSITORIES/hono (not /tmp)

comparison_to_s346_chalk.improvement: 5x lesson yield, persistent storage, richer architecture mapping

interpretation: First real persistent foreign genesis. 5 lessons about external architecture, 5 frontier questions — all grounded in code reading with specific line references. The swarm can accumulate external knowledge, not just meta-knowledge. Session 1 of 20-session falsification test (L-502).
meta_observations: Hono's SmartRouter dispatch pattern is ISO-1 (selection pressure) applied to routing algorithms
Hono's Fetch API abstraction is ISO-2 (universal interface) — same principle as swarm's tool-agnostic markdown
The 7-handler type limit is a capacity constraint analogous to context window limits
Hono's compose.ts (74 lines) and swarm's compose pattern are structurally similar middleware chains
next_session: Session 2: F1 (router benchmarking), F4 (header merge test), middleware deep-dive, JSX exploration
